intro: Synthyris schizantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf synthyris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Synthyris schizantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
